summary: To help at-risk pregnant women and parents with young children, the Affordable Care Act created the Maternal, Infant, and Early Childhood Home Visiting Program. It provides grants to states to fund home visits from a nurse, social worker, or other professional. The program builds upon decades of research showing that such visits can improve the lives of children and families. Many states provided similar services...
title: Maternal and Child Home Visiting Program: HHS Determined That States Generally Met the Maintenance of Effort Requirement
